In a message dated 3/4/03 11:25:01 AM Central Standard Time, 
cardhead649@... writes:


> "Look who's talking; I didn't take time out from a mission to make 
> out with my boyfriend," Empath snorts.  "In case you didn't notice, I 
> didn't have too much trouble getting past Hydras's little defensive 
> impant - would you like to find out just how much my power has 
> increased?"  Maxima is treading on thin ice; at this close range, 
> Empath could do just about anything she wants with her friend's 
> neural circuitry.  
> 

She looked at Emapth with a glitter in her optics. "Is that a challenge?" a 
wicked grin appeared upon her feline lips.

     "You fell for him like a brick, Maxima - there's > 
> no overriding your emotion chips anymore, like we used to before the 
> Great Reformat."
> 

She growled. "Alpha Trion made an enomous mistake resurrecting me & 
reformatting me." gazing out over the land. "As for Hydras, perhaps I did. 
Maybe I didn't. The organic side amplifies emotions far too much for my 
liking.' She pondered it a moment. "I assume that all the Seekers could see 
right through me when I am around Megatron?" she kicked herself. She had 
tried so hard for many millenia to not let any emotion show when she was 
around Megatron. She knew she showed compassion around Megatron. Placing him 
first & foremost above anything else.. including herself. 

"Or is this something you kept to yourself or recently noticed?" She glared 
at Empath. "I'm not one to allow emotions." she should know that. 

She glanced down then out over the land. "If Hydras has seduced me, it is 
only i his mind." though she wondered. He was not fully Megatron, since he 
was partly Galvatron. She didn't take kindly to Galvatron, since he would 
rather destroy them all than govern them.  

She turned to Empath. "Then... I suppose if you can still read my mind, you 
know what Hydras wants me to do." she looked at her, watching her.. to see 
her reaction. Remaining calm, she would see what Empath would do first. She 
had no intention at this time to carry out his orders... not yet.  

--part1_1eb.35c47a8.2b9661c3_boundary
Content-Type: text/html; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
